page.title: 03LIBANUS C.P. SCHOOL.
page.content: LIBANUS HAS A COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL IN THE VILLAGE.IT WAS BUILT IN 1877 AND OPENED ON JUNE 17TH 1878 WITH 36 PUPILS. ATTACHED TO THE SCHOOL WAS A HOUSE FOR THE HEAD_TEACHER, THIS WAS CONVERTED INTO A COMMUNITY CENTRE IN 1976.THERE ARE 2 CLASSES; THE INFANT (4_7YEARS) AND JUNIOR (7_11YEARS) NOVEMBER, 1985 THERE ARE 20 PUPILS ON ROLL.3 LIVE IN THE VILLAGE ITSELF THE OTHER 17 TRAVEL FROM FARMS AND NEARBY HAMLETS.AT 11 YEARS THE PUPILS TRANSFER TO THE COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL, BRECON HIGH SCHOOL. THE SCHOOL HAS A PLAYGROUND, PLAYING FIELD, CONVERTED FROM THE SCHOOL HOUSE GARDEN IN 1984, AND GARDENS LOOKED AFTER BY THE PUPILS.MEALS ARE COOKED IN THE KITCHEN AND SERVED IN THE COMMUNITY CENTRE. THE STAFF INCLUDE A HEAD_TEACHER, ASSISTANT TEACHER, COOK, CLEANER AND MIDDAY SUPERVISOR.
